3. City Manager (Chief Executive Officer)

City Manager (Chief Executive Officer)
======================================

The City Manager's Office is dedicated to providing high-quality public services and fostering a vibrant community in Ferris, Texas. Under the leadership of the City Manager, the office is responsible for all aspects of the operations of the city. Some of those key processes are:

* Performance Management and Accountability: Monitoring and evaluating city services to ensure they meet established standards and community expectations.
* Community Engagement and Communication: Facilitating transparent and meaningful communication between the city government and its residents, businesses, and stakeholders.
* Economic Development:
  Driving initiatives to attract new businesses, support existing enterprises, and promote sustainable growth. The City Manager also serves as the Executive Director of the Ferris Economic Development Corporation (EDC). An Economic Development Corporation (EDC) in Texas is a non-profit organization that leverages local resources to stimulate economic growth and development. EDCs use sales tax revenues to finance projects that enhance infrastructure, attract businesses, and improve the local quality of life. The Ferris EDC focuses on creating a robust economic environment by offering incentives, fostering entrepreneurship, and supporting workforce development.

With a commitment to continuous improvement and the adoption of the Baldrige Excellence Framework, the City Manager's Office strives to set the standard for a responsive and high-performing government.

### [FAQs](https://www.ferristexas.gov/Faq.aspx?TID=17)

[What is the role of the City Manager?](https://www.ferristexas.gov/158/City-Manager-Chief-Executive-Officer#)
:   The City Manager is the chief executive officer of Ferris, responsible for implementing the policies set by the City Council and overseeing the city’s daily operations and administration.

[How can I contact the City Manager’s Office?](https://www.ferristexas.gov/158/City-Manager-Chief-Executive-Officer#)
:   You can contact the City Manager's Office by calling 972-544-2110 or
    [emailing the City Manager](mailto:citymanager@ferristexas.gov)
    . For in-person visits, the office is located at 114 S Central Street, Ferris, TX 75125.

[How does the City Manager’s Office contribute to economic development?](https://www.ferristexas.gov/158/City-Manager-Chief-Executive-Officer#)
:   The City Manager’s Office plays a key role in economic development by fostering a business-friendly environment, supporting local businesses, and attracting new investments to the city. Additionally, the City Manager serves as the Executive Director of the Ferris Economic Development Corporation (EDC), which utilizes local sales tax revenues to fund projects that promote economic growth and improve community infrastructure.

[View All FAQs](https://www.ferristexas.gov/Faq.aspx?TID=17)
